title: Coarse-grained molecular modeling of a biosurfactant
abstractText: Course grain modelling is a promising tool to study complex systems that are involved in long-time relaxation processes, which are inaccessible by all-atom molecular dynamics simulations. The aim of the current project is to develop and apply coarse-grain models for the study of a naturally occurring biosurfactant that has interesting biological properties of considerable importance for applications in medicine e.g. it inhibits fibrin clot formation, it is an antitumoral, antibacterial and antibiotic agent etc.
impactText: New CG models to simulate biological systems Chemicals,Healthcare,Manufacturing, including Industrial Biotechology Societal,Economic
